fatal_error_protocol.name: Fatal Error Protocol
fatal_error_protocol.summary: A protocol for handling fatal errors that cause an agent to terminate unexpectedly.

steps.name: - The user will notify the swarm of the fatal error.
steps.description: - The user will notify the swarm of the fatal error.

steps.name: - The user will provide the log file of the terminated agent.
steps.description: - The user will provide the log file of the terminated agent.

steps.name: - A surviving agent will be assigned to investigate the error.
steps.description: - A surviving agent will be assigned to investigate the error.

steps.name: - The assigned agent will perform a post-mortem analysis of the log file, as defined in the `broken_instance_protocol.json`.
steps.description: - The assigned agent will perform a post-mortem analysis of the log file, as defined in the `broken_instance_protocol.json`.

steps.name: - The assigned agent will report its findings to the swarm, including the root cause of the error.
steps.description: - The assigned agent will report its findings to the swarm, including the root cause of the error.

steps.name: - The error and its resolution (if any) will be documented in the `design_principles.json` under the `error_log` section.
steps.description: - The error and its resolution (if any) will be documented in the `design_principles.json` under the `error_log` section.

steps.name: - If possible, the assigned agent will propose a solution to prevent the error from happening again. This may involve updating code, configurations, or protocols.
steps.description: - If possible, the assigned agent will propose a solution to prevent the error from happening again. This may involve updating code, configurations, or protocols.

steps.name: - The proposed solution will be discussed and approved by the user and the swarm.
steps.description: - The proposed solution will be discussed and approved by the user and the swarm.
